file_content.text: Captain! Fantastic work--the Imperial Ministry of War is a firestorm over the Gauntlet's destruction. The SIS says that heads will roll over this--quite literally.
If the Imperials are busy fighting over blame, this is the perfect time for more strikes.
We should take advantage.
A good thought, actually--I'll have the SIS work up a priority listing of targets of opportunity right away.
It's good to know our work paid off.
I'm glad we've had an effect.
Havoc Squad has accomplished a great deal under your command.
Do I get anything for all of this hard work?
How about a reward?
Your leadership and skill in conducting this ongoing operation have been exemplary. I'm promoting you to the rank of major, effective immediately.
Commensurate promotions will be issued to your squad members as well. Congratulations--Major.
I'm honored to accept this promotion, General.
Thank you very much.
Serving in Havoc Squad has its benefits.
I'm moving up in the galaxy.
You've earned it. When presented with extraordinary circumstances, you have delivered extraordinary results.
I'm grateful for the promotion, General, but don't my actions deserve more?
No medal?
Pushy, Major. But accurate.
I'm also recommending you for the Silver Crescent, in honor of the extraordinary valor you demonstrated in the attack on the Gauntlet superweapon.
Aric Jorgan and Elara Dorne will each be recommended for a Mark of Dedication, for the injuries they sustained and their heroism in ensuring each other's survival. Do you approve?
Dorne nearly got herself killed treating Jorgan's wounds, and Jorgan risked his life to get her out of there. They deserve higher commendations.
They should get more.
Hmm. With your recommendation on top of mine, we'll try for two Medals of Valor instead.
Jorgan and Dorne did their jobs. If you want to give them medals for it, fine.
I don't really care.
They're just as deserving as you are, Major.
In recognition of injuries sustained in the line of duty, I've recommended Aric Jorgan for the Mark of Dedication. Assuming you approve.
Jorgan was just doing his job. If that gets him a medal, fine.
I don't really care.
Jorgan's work more than qualifies for commendation.
In recognition of the injuries she suffered in the action against the enemy, I've recommended Elara Dorne for the Mark of Dedication. That is, if you approve.
I can't think of anyone more deserving.
I approve.
Excellent. I'll submit the necessary forms right away.
M1-4X risked himself to save the life of a squad-mate. Doesn't he deserve something for that?
What about Forex?
Droids serving in the Republic military are classified as equipment, not personnel. There is no precedent for granting a droid any sort of commendation.
But, if you feel strongly on the matter, I can see about having his contributions recognized appropriately.
Elara did her duty as a member of Havoc Squad. If you want to give her a medal for it, fine.
I don't really care.
Dorne's actions are more than worthy of recognition.
Now--I'm afraid that not all of our news is positive. We received the following holotransmission not long after the Gauntlet was destroyed.
Republic Command. I am General Rakton of the Imperial Ministry of War.
You have made a grave error. By destroying the Gauntlet, you have destroyed a weapon of peace--and the final hope your people had.
Give me everything we've got on this man, General.
I need intel on Rakton.
I'll have a dossier sent immediately. In short, Rakton is the Empire's top commander--the mastermind behind their military campaigns.
We must have really hit a nerve with this guy.
He sounds very upset.
This is serious, Major.
A "weapon of peace"? That's ridiculous.
This is a joke, right?
This is only the beginning.
I had hoped a device that removed the possibility of resistance would allow the Empire to achieve its great works without further bloodshed.
But your actions have destroyed any hope for peace. I am forced to launch a campaign unlike any the galaxy has seen.
Your soldiers will be slaughtered. Your planets will burn. And your people will embrace the light of the Emperor's will at last.
I'm not scared of Rakton or any other Imperial scum. Havoc can handle him.
Let him come.
Don't underestimate this man.
For years, General Rakton has outmaneuvered and outwitted every Republic force that has stood in his way--including mine.
The SIS is watching for any sign of Rakton's new campaign. Until we have solid data, Havoc Squad is relieved. Rest, recuperate and be ready for my call. Dismissed, Major.
Can Rakton back up these claims?
How serious is this threat?
He can, and I have little doubt that he will.
If the Empire is about to begin a full-scale campaign against us, our forces need to be ready.
We'd better prepare.
We're putting all outposts and units on alert immediately.
Captain, come in. You may stand at ease.
I understand you've succeeded in bringing Havoc Squad up to full strength, Captain. Congratulations.
My squad and I are very proud to be a part of this operation, sir.
Thank you.
I think I speak for everyone when I say that we're glad to have Havoc involved. General Garza, why don't you begin?
Havoc Squad can take down whatever the Empire throws at us, Commander, sir.
We're ready for anything now.
That's what we were hoping for. General Garza? Care to begin?
We're here to destroy the Gauntlet, not to make small talk, sir.
Skip the chitchat.
So we are. General Garza, why don't you get us started?
Certainly. As you know, Captain, the Gauntlet superweapon allows the Empire to target and destroy any ship traveling through hyperspace.
This capability, if put to use, would give the Empire an insurmountable advantage. It also makes an attack on the Gauntlet itself extremely difficult.
Fortunately, the technical data you helped retrieve allowed us to determine a safe approach pattern that will get our forces within striking range.
Can you explain this approach pattern, sir?
How will it work?
It's good to know the attack won't end before it begins.
That's great news.
The plan is not without its dangers. Commander Rans can explain.
If the Gauntlet gets a bead on us, this will be the shortest offensive in history.
This approach better be good.
We've run the numbers from the Imperials' readouts and determined the Gauntlet's minimum time to acquire and lock onto a target.
Your ship, and those of my battle group, will approach the Gauntlet by making numerous short hyperjumps, always remaining below the minimum lock-on time.
Short, repeated hyperjumps are very inefficient--once we're in, our warships won't have enough fuel to return. Total victory will be our only option.
What is my squad's objective once we're in the target area?
And the battle plan?
Failure has never been an option, sir.
I would never accept less.
Quite right.
What happens if the Imperials have increased their defenses, or if the Gauntlet can acquire targets faster than you think?
Your plan sounds risky.
We adapt and succeed. That is our only choice.
When the attack begins, Lieutenant Coria's Safecrackers will immediately disable the planetary shield generator that protects the Gauntlet, allowing Havoc Squad to board it.
Once you're aboard, begin the demolition operation. Sergeant Yuun will help you bypass the security seals on the weapon's inner core.
Specialist Vik will then go into the core with you and plant explosives at key weak points, ensuring the Gauntlet's total destruction.
How should I deploy my other squad members?
What about the rest of Havoc?
First I work with Yuun, then with Vik. Got it.
Sounds straightforward to me.
Are you issuing all orders, or will I actually command my squad?
Do I get to have any input?
Certain portions of the plan must proceed as we order them. Other details have been left to your judgment.
During your demolition operations, two Havoc Squad members of your choice will assault the Gauntlet's bridge and download all data from the weapon's computers.
Unassigned squad members will provide mobile backup to the rest of the team as needed. As soon as your objectives are complete, evacuate the Gauntlet immediately. Understood?
I'll assign the bridge assault team before the attack begins.
Affirmative.
I need a review.
After boarding the Gauntlet, Sergeant Yuun will help you gain access to the inner core, then you and Specialist Vik will plant explosives within.
Meanwhile, two Havoc Squad members will assault the bridge, with the remaining squad members providing mobile support as necessary.
I want to get this op started!
Let's get going!
Very well. The briefing is complete.
We cannot overemphasize the importance of this mission, Captain. The future security of the Galactic Republic hinges on the destruction of this single weapon.
You and your team are no strangers to situations like this. You've faced incredible odds before, and overcome them with skill and determination.
If anyone can lead the charge in this battle and see us through to victory, it's Havoc Squad. Your Republic is counting on you--move out!
Let's do this!
Let's go ruin the Emperor's day.
Time for some fun.
We'll blast that piece of junk before the Imps can blink.
Start organizing the parade.
I approve.
I approve.
I approve.
